title: pretty print the xml edited by the kogito plugin so github diff view actually works
body:
i.e. trying to use editor editing https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts/blob/master/using-kogito/src/main/resources/org/acme/kogito/persons.bpmn2 you end up with a massive diff just to change the position of a box.

The actual diff is just a single parameter change.

if the plugin would pretty print the generated xml this would be  a much smoother experience.

title: NA
body: Hi @maxandersen! Thanks for your suggestion. I guess pretty-printing the output would indeed result in better diffs. Of course some times the "formatting" we use to pretty-print would differ from the original format of the file, but I guess on a second run, if changing a file that's been previously formatted by us, we would have a much nicer diff than a one-liner.

title: NA
body: @romartin I think there is already a JIRA for this one right?

title: NA
body:
One thing I noticed is that even though we format the XML, some properties change regardless. Take a look: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1584568/68046607-07b69180-fcbb-11e9-9bdd-22a5eaaf24a6.png)

The only change I did on the diagram was renaming the "Exclusive gateway", but those (and many other) ids were also changed.

title: NA
body:
That diff is still better than the past one.
But yeah, would have been nice if you had stable ids but I guess we can't get everything :)

title: NA
body:
Hey @ederign @maxandersen @tiagobento 
Yeah I think somebody already pointed that out, the exported BPMN process (in XML format) is not properly pretty-pinted on the kogito environment. I'd searching for that ticket and I cannot find it, so would appreciate if you can plz some of you guys report the issue, thanks in advance for the collaboration!

title: NA
body:
ok thanks @porcelli - you just reported https://issues.jboss.org/browse/KOGITO-541
<3

title: How to create the vsix package?
body: Hi all, I built the extension, how can I create a .vsix file?

title: NA
body:
Hi @dmarrazzo,

After built the extension, go to: packages/vscode-extension-pack-kogito-kie-editors

And run: yarn run pack-extension

The vsix file will be in dist directory.

title: NA
body: Great! Thank you

title: [VSCode] Undo is not supported in some cases
body:
Hi, 

I noticed that the undo in VSCode is not working in some cases, for example when you create a decision or new input nodes (and so on). 
In addition to those cases, it does not work when you set the type for the decisions and you try undo the steps (but actually in those cases I might agree that the undo should just work on the visual components, i.e. it should not undo stuff on the background like type of decisions and other properties).

title: NA
body:
@r00ta  that's expected for now, the Undo/Redo commands from vscode are not yet bound to the extension state control. We are aiming to the new VSCode API to finally doing it. 

Thanks for your message, I'll keep you posted as soon as we integrate it.

title: NA
body: @r00ta I'll be tackling the issue on this JIRA https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-883, hopefully it will be ready soon ;)

title: NA
body: Fixed by: https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-tooling/commit/b203e71065a8d5bde6a364c0ca7bf47f537d18c8

title: React should be a peer dependencies
body:
https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-tooling/blob/master/packages/core-api/package.json#L15-L18

One think I noticed working on [the AtlasMap POC](https://github.com/riccardo-forina/atlasmap-kogito-tooling) is that I was getting the [Invalid Hook Call Warning
](https://reactjs.org/warnings/invalid-hook-call-warning.html) error in the console. Ultimately, it was due to `@kogito/core-api` declaring React as direct dependency, which causes for multiple versions of React being embedded in the bundle. Since AtlasMap is written solely using hooks, this issue come up immediately.

A [quick workaround](https://github.com/riccardo-forina/atlasmap-kogito-tooling/blob/master/packages/simple-react-editors/webpack.config.js#L32-L45) was to instruct WebPack to consider React an external dependency, but it would be better to make React and React DOM peer dependencies in the `core-api` package.

title: NA
body:
Hi @riccardo-forina!

Thanks for reporting that. I'm glad to see you're using our packages :)

Initially, we thought that we should be the ones in control of React/ReactDOM versions, since some things that we offer as a library/framework is dependent on the React API. You can simply remove your declaration of React and ReactDOM on your modules so that no conflicting versions exist.

However, I also think that we should give users the flexibility of choosing the exact React version to use. Since peerDependencies are not downloaded by default, we would be making it mandatory to declare your version of React/ReactDOM. More than that, it would be possible to choose an incompatible version of React/ReactDOM, resulting in build failures.

Maybe I'm missing something here, but I'm really not sure yet what's I think is the best approach, so if you could provide more information about why having your own declaring of React/ReactDOM is important, I guess it would help us make a decision :)

title: NA
body:
React requires a single instance of React DOM for it to properly work. React and React DOM should be a dependency of the final consumer. Taking the template as an example, React and React DOM should be declared as a dependency of the `chrome-extension-pack-simple-react` and `vscode-extension-pack-simple-react` packages that are the "final" outputs. `simple-react-editor` should also declare React as a peer dependency, since that package acts as a library and not a final output.

I think it's a bit easier if we visualize the problem. I cloned the template repo, instructed webpack to generate the stats file to feed to [`webpack-bundle-analyzer`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/webpack-bundle-analyzer) and run it against the `simple-react-editor` package and the `chrome-extension-pack-simple-react`. Here is the result:

## `simple-react-editor`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/966316/85110981-ff906f80-b213-11ea-8f19-6685059a48cf.png)

This package gets bundled together with React, because React is a direct dependency of the `core-api` package.

## `chrome-extension-pack-simple-react`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/966316/85111040-0fa84f00-b214-11ea-9bfe-3d7cea091c03.png)

This package gets bundled together with React too because React is a direct dependency of the `core-api` package, but since there is also a dependency on `simple-react-editor` an additional copy of React gets bundled in the final output.

This leads to a bigger bundle size because of the duplicated version of React, and to bugs like the one in the opening comment.

In general the rule of thumb should be that if you are distributing a reusable module, dependencies should be declared as peer dependencies so to avoid these issues. It's then up to the consumer of the library to add the required dependencies to its project. For example, if I want to use, say, [`react-table`](https://github.com/tannerlinsley/react-table/blob/master/package.json#L46-L48) I also have to add `react` as a dependency to my project.

title: NA
body:
Oh yes... Let me begin by apologising, but the thing is that our `kogito-tooling-examples` repo is a little bit out of date 😅 

@caponetto Is currently working on updating the repo so that these issues are fixed.

On our packages in the `kogito-tooling` repo, we treat React and ReactDOM as externals (using WebPack) and rely on it being transitively downloaded by `@kogito-tooling/core-api`. This makes only one "instance" of React being package in our bundles, keeping the bundle size to a minimum.

Hope that makes sense, WDYT?

title: NA
body:
I mean, your project your rules :D 

Let's say that this would be quite an exception in the npm ecosystem and would limit peers to use the provided template and tools (what if I don't want to use webpack? Sure things like rollup allow for declaring external global dependencies, but I don't see why adding this cognitive burden to users).

title: NA
body:
Yeah, I understand. My main concern with letting the user decide their version of React/ReactDOM is that they choose one that is not compatible with what we deliver. I know `peerDependencies` is there to **warn** people about that, but it's still error prone.. I guess we can't have it all, right? :)

Thanks again for raising this issue. We'll create a ticket for that and prioritise it accordingly. Feel free to add more to that if you want!

title: NA
body: Created https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-2573. I'll comment here as we have updates.

title: NA
body:
@riccardo-forina I've been thinking about this issue a lot, but I think here's what makes the most sense to me.

When you're creating `Editor`s in React, the package containing them is responsible for providing a React component that's actually an editor, so essentially, this package is a 'library'. Let's say you create a package called `my-editor`.

Of course, to run this editor, you'll need an 'app'. That's what we call the Envelope, which is essentially a webapp that runs inside an iframe in a containing 'app', which we call the Channel (e.g. Desktop, VS Code, Chrome Extension etc).

To create this Envelope 'app', we provide a library called `microeditor-envelope` (we'll probably rename that to `envelope-lib`, so that's how I'm going to refer to that from now on).

This Envelope 'app' is actually assembled with the help of two libraries -- `my-editor` and `envelope-lib`. Let's say that your Envelope application is created in your `my-envelope-app` package.

With all that said, I think that `envelope-lib` and `my-editor` should declare React and ReactDOM as peerDependencies, and the Envelope application should declare them as a dependencies. (See an Envelope application `index.ts` example here: https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-tooling-examples/blob/master/packages/chrome-extension-pack-simple-react/src/envelope/index.ts

The ideal hierarchy of packages is as follows:


```
         my-envelope-app <-- (That's where we declare React and ReactDOM as `dependency`)
         /             \
envelope-lib         my-editor
                          \
                        editor-api
```

As you might've noticed, we don't have a package called `editor-api`, making `my-editor` depend on `core-api` and `envelope-lib`, which is not ideal.

This way, only 'app' packages would declare a concrete version of React and ReactDOM, making everything else peer-depend on React and ReactDOM. This gives more flexibility for users of our platform. How does that sound to you? :)

---

**NOTE:** One thing I'd like to clarify that is not related to this whole conversation above is how we mark a dependency as `external`. It's the bundlers job to do that (e.g. Webpack), and the reason you're seeing React and ReactDOM bundled inside `simple-react-editor` on `kogito-tooling-examples` is because the `webpack.config.js` is wrong. See https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-tooling-examples/blob/master/packages/simple-react-editors/webpack.config.js#L30.

This line should actually be like this one: https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-tooling/blob/master/packages/kie-bc-editors/webpack.config.js#L32.

This makes Webpack bundle the package without its dependencies, making it only contain the classes it exports.

title: NA
body: cc @manstis @caponetto

title: NA
body: Yup I think I’m with you. If I may, check out [tsdx](https://github.com/formik/tsdx) as a library boilerplate generator. It uses rollup under the hood that’s more suited to create libraries than webpack and makes working with this stuff easier.

title: NA
body:
@riccardo-forina Thanks for the tip! :)

I'll keep updating this issue until we have the ideal package hierarchy.

title: NA
body: We removed the `core-api` module in favor of a more suitable package organization (see #224). React is no longer a hard-dependency for creatin Editors. Thank you @riccardo-forina for pointing that out! Expect more news around our tooling for creating your own Editors soon. Closing the issue.

title: downloaded file from online editor keeps "new-file" as model name in DMN models
body:
When you download your DMN model file from the online editor it keeps `new-file` as the internal model name.
You can only change this in the raw XML.

```
<dmn:definitions xmlns:dmn="http://www.omg.org/spec/DMN/20180521/MODEL/" xmlns="https://kiegroup.org/dmn/_FC75913D-81CF-49A3-A6F4-A56FB341C574" xmlns:di="http://www.omg.org/spec/DMN/20180521/DI/" xmlns:kie="http://www.drools.org/kie/dmn/1.2" xmlns:dmndi="http://www.omg.org/spec/DMN/20180521/DMNDI/" xmlns:dc="http://www.omg.org/spec/DMN/20180521/DC/" xmlns:feel="http://www.omg.org/spec/DMN/20180521/FEEL/" id="_72BA4308-069E-4F8D-8608-D4FDDFA5A1A5" name="new-file" typeLanguage="http://www.omg.org/spec/DMN/20180521/FEEL/" namespace="https://kiegroup.org/dmn/_FC75913D-81CF-49A3-A6F4-A56FB341C574">
```

title: Run FDB
body:
This issue's purpose is to provide means for people to build Kogito Tooling using their forks of the DMN, BPMN and Test Scenario editors. To trigger a build, comment using the following format:

`Build: {my-github-username}/{my-branch-name}`

This will trigger a build of the downstream repositories and will take your branch into account. The resulting artifacts can be downloaded from the Artifacts tab on the triggered Workflow run.

title: Will there be a tool for edit gdst Guided Decision Table?
body: I have used KIE workbench for quite a long time but I wanna search for an alternative tool to modeling Guided Decision Table and Business Process. I found this kogito tool provider a great model tool for BPMN and DMN, but I cannot found any editor for GDST file. Is there any plan for it?

title: NA
body: Hi @einverne, unfortunately, and due to resource constraints, a GDST is currently not on our short/mid-term roadmap.

title: NA
body:
> Hi @einverne, unfortunately, and due to resource constraints, a GDST is currently not on our short/mid-term roadmap. 

Thank you for this quick response. I close the issue now.

title: Online Editor Doesn't Have Include Models Option
body:
When we open a DMN file in VS Code extension, we get an option to include model from other dmns as shown in below snapshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53901880/97200759-a0e98c80-17d7-11eb-89ab-3b8289a42963.png)
But this option is not present in Online Editor. Will this be part of the roadmap?

title: NA
body:
Hi @himanshu-sharma073! Thanks for filling an issue.

The ability to read 3rd-party files (in that case, included models) is currently only supported on VS Code. This work in something on our radar but not currently a short term priority.

An implementation of this feature on our Desktop application would be pretty straightforward, though. That's also a nice opportunity for a community contribution. We can assist you on the process if you're interested!

title: How to use this  tool in web?
NA
body: Hi there, check it out the [kogito tooling examples repository](https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-tooling-examples)! It has a [web application](https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-tooling-examples/tree/master/packages/webapp) example built with React.

title: NA
body:
Adding to what @ljmotta replied, @bixiaocong could you please give more details of your use case?

Do you want to use kogito tooling to write your web apps or to embed BPMN/DMN editor on your apps? Or it's another thing?

title: NA
body: Hi @bixiaocong . I'll close this issue, but feel free to ask to re-open it if you need.

title: How can I add support to a custom task?
body:
I export some bpmn files from KIE workbench, then I found there is a `bpmn2:task` tag in bpmn file which this kogito-tooling is not currently supported. I tried to build and run the project. But I cannot found a way to modify it. Are there any instructions to show how to add support to this kind of task node?

```
    <bpmn2:task id="_7FB7AFF4-C7FC-4CB8-BA91-1C2643106FAF" drools:taskName="CommonWorkItem" name="Name">
      <bpmn2:extensionElements>
        <drools:metaData name="elementname">
          <drools:metaValue><![CDATA[Name]]></drools:metaValue>
        </drools:metaData>
        <drools:onEntry-script scriptFormat="http://www.java.com/java">
          <drools:script><![CDATA[v.execute("some");]]></drools:script>
        </drools:onEntry-script>
      </bpmn2:extensionElements>
      <bpmn2:incoming>_8DFEDB4E-2DB3-48D2-955F-F8DDB4DF6902</bpmn2:incoming>
      <bpmn2:outgoing>_D5950703-3DF3-46FA-BBC9-ABDC197CA831</bpmn2:outgoing>
      <bpmn2:ioSpecification id="_LmiULhjNEeuldeHdBwNIyA">
        <bpmn2:dataInput id="_7FB7AFF4-C7FC-4CB8-BA91-1C2643106FAF_vInputX" drools:dtype="com.xiaomi.mifi.policy.model.ProcessVariable" itemSubjectRef="__7FB7AFF4-C7FC-4CB8-BA91-1C2643106FAF_vInputXItem" name="v"/>
        <bpmn2:dataInput id="_7FB7AFF4-C7FC-4CB8-BA91-1C2643106FAF_TaskNameInputX" drools:dtype="Object" name="TaskName"/>
        <bpmn2:inputSet id="_LmiULxjNEeuldeHdBwNIyA">
          <bpmn2:dataInputRefs>_7FB7AFF4-C7FC-4CB8-BA91-1C2643106FAF_vInputX</bpmn2:dataInputRefs>
          <bpmn2:dataInputRefs>_7FB7AFF4-C7FC-4CB8-BA91-1C2643106FAF_TaskNameInputX</bpmn2:dataInputRefs>
        </bpmn2:inputSet>
        <bpmn2:outputSet id="_LmiUMBjNEeuldeHdBwNIyA"/>
      </bpmn2:ioSpecification>
      <bpmn2:dataInputAssociation id="_LmiUMRjNEeuldeHdBwNIyA">
        <bpmn2:sourceRef>v</bpmn2:sourceRef>
        <bpmn2:targetRef>_7FB7AFF4-C7FC-4CB8-BA91-1C2643106FAF_vInputX</bpmn2:targetRef>
      </bpmn2:dataInputAssociation>
      <bpmn2:dataInputAssociation id="_LmiUMhjNEeuldeHdBwNIyA">
        <bpmn2:targetRef>_7FB7AFF4-C7FC-4CB8-BA91-1C2643106FAF_TaskNameInputX</bpmn2:targetRef>
        <bpmn2:assignment id="_LmiUMxjNEeuldeHdBwNIyA">
          <bpmn2:from xsi:type="bpmn2:tFormalExpression" id="_LmiUNBjNEeuldeHdBwNIyA"><![CDATA[CommonWorkItem]]></bpmn2:from>
          <bpmn2:to xsi:type="bpmn2:tFormalExpression" id="_LmiUNRjNEeuldeHdBwNIyA">_7FB7AFF4-C7FC-4CB8-BA91-1C2643106FAF_TaskNameInputX</bpmn2:to>
        </bpmn2:assignment>
      </bpmn2:dataInputAssociation>
    </bpmn2:task>
```

title: NA
body:
Hi @einverne and @rasa-app!

Looks like both your issues are related to custom work item definition support and custom tasks.

We kind have initial support for WID, it's just a matter of placing the wid file in the same directory of your bpmn file on VS Code.

But keep in mind the following limitations:

- The wid parser currently is a POC. The official implementation is tracked here: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-3527
- There are some types of business central that are currently not supported. See https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-3529 for more details


On your case @rasa-app , looks like your are experiencing this bug: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-3528

title: NA
body:
thanks @ederign for your response, I also think there is no bug. In case the custom tasks are not declared for kogito (so they don't appear on the left-hand palette as well), the marshaller generates just a regular task node.
Anyway, please @einverne try to create the right .wid file in same directory as your process is placed, and let us know if then the export is successful. 
Thanks!

title: NA
body: @einverne we did some improvements on this area on Kogito tooling 0.9.0. Could you please verify if it fixed your issue?

title: NA
body: @einverne I'm closing this one due to inactivity. If you need any further help or find any other issue, please let us know! Thanks.

title: Using embedded editors
body:
Hi,

Please see https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-apps/pull/654

I am unable to embed the `DmnEditor` following the instructions I can find.

Can you please assist.

title: NA
body: Hi @manstis ! What are the instructions you're using? From I see on your PR, the problem is likely the `origin: ''` parameter you're passing to the DMN Standalone Editor. Please don't pass any `origin` so that the default values are used.

title: NA
body: Great thank-you @tiagobento. `origin` removed and all good. Works fine.

title: Support condition expressions in sequence flows
body:
Hi, could you add support for actually writing condition expressions?

The UI is already almost there:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1181744/108856998-ec2b7480-75ea-11eb-90df-59ac6b4c0675.png)

I would like to be able to express the following:

```xml
<bpmn2:sequenceFlow id="SequenceFlow_1" name="eventName" sourceRef="Task_1" targetRef="ExclusiveGateway_2">
      <bpmn2:conditionExpression xsi:type="bpmn2:tFormalExpression" id="FormalExpression_1" language="http://www.example.com/language">some-expression</bpmn2:conditionExpression>
</bpmn2:sequenceFlow>
```

I can help, if provided some guidance :)

(this is a copy of https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tooling-store/issues/39, which was the wrong repo, I guess?)

@romartin is the lead of this area and can provide you assistance on this!

title: NA

title: Standalone editor and CSP
body:
Hi everyone,

I tried to integrate the standalone DME editor into a site with a strict CSP and as you may expect it only thrown a bunch of errors in the js console. After looking at the code I saw that there is an iframe loaded with a few inline scripts and a ton of other scripts.

```
Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'none';base-uri 'none';manifest-src 'self';script-src 'nonce-foobar=' blob:;style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline';img-src 'self' data: blob:;font-src 'self' data:;connect-src 'self';media-src 'self';frame-src 'self';frame-ancestors 'self';worker-src 'self';form-action 'self'
```

Is there any way to get this working without creating my own bundled standalone editor? Why is the iframe needed at all?

Sorry, I never used kogito tooling before, so my questions quite be a bit clumsy.

Best regards,
Klaus

title: NA
body:
Hi @sualko,

Those console errors are not related to CSP errors, but a known issue on this distribution. They can be safely ignored (soon we will fix those false alarms).

Regarding iframe usage, we mostly use them to isolate context from the outer application (micro front-end friendly). We don't use the iframe "src" attribute, but instead we use “srcdoc” to include all the necessary resources for the editor loading inline, so the editor's bundle works without any external resources. 

Kind Regards,
Paulo.

title: NA
body:
> Those console errors are not related to CSP errors

I think they are related, because they need inline scripts and eval.

> They can be safely ignored 

That's wrong, since the execution is stopped.

title: NA
body: @sualko If the errors you're having are different than the ones I mentioned ([tracked here](https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-4152)), then I'll need a reproducer (or at least the log with the errors) to see them to be able to provide more information.

title: NA
body: Just create a site with `script-src 'nonce-foobar=' blob:;` as part of the csp and you will see errors that the scripts can't be executed due to missing nonce. You could also create a csp with `script-src 'self';` with the same error, because this application is generating inline script blocks. To overcome this issue you need something similar to webpacks [__webpack_nonce__](https://webpack.js.org/guides/csp/).

title: NA
body: I've created a [JIRA](https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-4590) to track this. We will analyze the issue and get back to you here.

title: NA
body: Due to inactivity, we are closing this issue, but it is still tracked on https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-4590

title: Describe proper setup of environment for build
body: There is no section about how to setup the environment for the building from source at https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-tooling/blob/master/README.md#build-from-source . What are minimal required versions of NodeJS, NPM, Yarn or any other tool like lerna.

title: NA
body: Hi Marek, these infos are on the "Develop" section on the README. See https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-tooling/blob/master/README.md#develop. Lerna should be included there as well. Thanks for pointing that out.

title: NA
body:
well, i meant something more helpful to start from scratch. Like really minimal versions can be these on CI system, but it is not written like that so anybody can start with for instance NodeJS v14.17.0 which is LTS. So my idea was more on having strict border as minimal build tools versions.
If CI uses 16.2.0 and nobody will use older i would take it as the minimal required one.

title: NA
body: The CI is our source of truth, if the CI uses a version, everyone should be using that. Can you please review the PR with more concrete suggestions on what to improve?

title: NA
body: Fixed on #530

title: FEEL expression doesn't work on input list
body:
Hello, I hope this is the right bug tracker for my issue.

I have a DMN model, exported from the KIE sandbox as the following ZIP file [test-list-combiner.zip](https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-tooling/files/7604694/test-list-combiner.zip).

There are two leaf filters which return either "Rejected" or "Approved". A list kind decision box aggregates its results in a list. Then the top level decision boxes evaluate this list. If there is at least one "Rejected", the result is "Rejected". Otherwise it's "Approved".

The problem is on how the evaluation nodes are implemented. As show below, the FEEL expression is used in the output column and this setup is working correctly.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/261458/143485138-0fba9502-60e0-4bba-ad7f-260c3fc3cc3a.png)

However, when I have this other setup below, the rejected state is not picked up from the list.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/261458/143485392-8f1a1d58-67f1-426e-963a-cea550caa834.png)

Any idea of what's going on?

title: NA
body:
Hi @diegonc, sorry for the late reply.

To let your example work, please substitute the `Combine Filters` parameter of `list contains` function with `?` special character, like the following:

`contains( ? , "Rejected")`

![Screenshot from 2021-12-09 14-49-42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16005046/145408505-b1951cc9-170b-4f5b-9ff9-4b1c98f752a2.png)

This is required whenever you need to extend a unary test using a built-in function. "?" represents the actual variable value.

References: https://www.omg.org/spec/DMN/1.2/PDF 8.3.3 point d) page 92

title: NA
body: Thanks! It's working now. I'll close this ticket since it's not a bug

body:
Hi @cheanwei,

it is an known issue: [KOGITO-5373](https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-5373)  right now we are working on new marshallers which should be much more resilient to this kind of issues.

Meanwhile you can add `id="anyId"` to definitions BPMN tag like this:
```xml
<definitions xmlns="http://www.omg.org/spec/BPMN/20100524/MODEL" [...]>

replace to 

<definitions id="anyId" xmlns="http://www.omg.org/spec/BPMN/20100524/MODEL" [...]>
```

And after that it will be possible to use provided file.

title: JIT DMN validation in Online Editor returns 500 error when editing DMN file with Included Models
body:
**Summary**
DMN validation does not work in online-editor if the file being edited includes and uses types or decisions from another DMN file (Included Models feature). Looks like online-editor sends only the contents of the current file and does not include imported resources in the request payload.

**Test Case**
1. Open https://sandbox.kie.org/ -> Upload -> Select folder - select the folder with DMN files from [validateIncludedIssue.zip](https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-tooling/files/7745462/validateIncludedIssue.zip). There are 2 DMN files in this folder: root.dmn and types.dmn. root.dmn imports types.dmn and contains a single "const" decision that returns a value of type "types.CustomType" defined in types.dmn. This is just for demo purposes, any case with Included Models will do.
2. Select "root" decision and try to edit it.

**Expected Result**
/jitdmn/validate endpoint successfully returns with errors  / warnings / no messages - depending on the changes

**Actual Result**
/jitdmn/validate endpoint returns 500 http status code
DMN Runner logs:
```
msg: Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not locate required dependency while importing DMN for namespace: https://kiegroup.org/dmn/_0D827E3F-36ED-4005-9632-3386FCC7C176, name: types, modelName: null.
msg: 	at org.kie.dmn.feel.util.Either.getOrElseThrow(Either.java:64)
msg: 	at org.kie.dmn.core.assembler.DMNAssemblerService.enrichDMNResourcesWithImportsDependencies(DMNAssemblerService.java:138)
msg: 	at org.kie.dmn.validation.DMNValidatorImpl$ValidatorBuilderImpl.internalValidatorSortModels(DMNValidatorImpl.java:329)
msg: 	at org.kie.dmn.validation.DMNValidatorImpl$ValidatorBuilderImpl.theseModels(DMNValidatorImpl.java:248)
msg: 	at org.kie.kogito.jitexecutor.dmn.api.ValidationResource.schema(ValidationResource.java:76)
msg: 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:566)
msg: 	at org.jboss.resteasy.core.MethodInjectorImpl.invoke(MethodInjectorImpl.java:170)
```

**Root Cause**
online-editor doesn't send the contents of the included resource in the payload:
`
{
  "mainURI": "root.dmn",
  "resources": [
    {
      "URI": "root.dmn",
      "content": "..."
    }
  ]
}
`

title: NA
body:
Hi @ddavidyuk! Thanks for trying our tools and taking the time to write those issues. It really helps us improve!

This is indeed an issue and we're already looking into fixing it. There are two major points to consider here:

1. We need to know which models are referenced from the open model. Recursively. We're already planning to add support for that on https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-6141
2. Although the KIE Tooling Extended Services validation route already accepts sending multiple models, it needs also to associate validation messages with the path of the file. cc @tarilabs

Let's keep this issue open until we have a proper fix for it. We'll keep it up to date.

title: NA
body:
Not sure why I've been tagged in this one @tiagobento ?
I believe the JIT runner already supports the multiple models per original requirements, proof:

https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-apps/blob/1005280f701b43871145243e67bb7c4ca5220d8b/jitexecutor/jitexecutor-dmn/src/test/java/org/kie/kogito/jitexecutor/dmn/api/MultipleModelsTest.java#L118-L131

If there is any bug newly discovered, please let me know.
Hope this helps.

title: NA
body: @tarilabs Hi Matteo! Thanks for jumping in. The `validate` endpoint does indeed support multiple files, but the messages returned don't have the `path` of the file that originated that message. For us to present these "multi-file" validation messages on the screen, users should be able to see which file originated which message. Does that make sense?

title: NA
body:
@tiagobento please track it as a KOGITO jira assigned to me about this new requirement.
I'd be happy to take a look into it.

title: NA
body: @tarilabs Created the following Jira: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-6471 to track this improvement.

title: NA
body: Fixed.

title: Cannot use context merge / put  FEEL functions in online-editor
body:
**Test case:**
1. Create a decision in Online Editor with type = literal expression and code: `context merge([{a: 1}, {b: 2}])`

**Expected Result:**
1. No validation errors

**Actual Result:**
1. Validation error: `ERR_COMPILING_FEEL: Error compiling FEEL expression 'context merge([{a: 1}, {b: 2}])' for name 'FEEL func' on node 'FEEL func': syntax error near 'merge'`

**Root cause:**
Looks like Kie Extended Services module ships with DMN Runner that depends on kie-dmn-core version 7.59.0.Final, this version does not support new FEEL functions.

Is it possible to bump the kie-dmn-core version to 7.62.0.Final at least? We would like to use the functions defined in https://github.com/kiegroup/drools/blob/7.62.0.Final/kie-dmn/kie-dmn-feel/src/main/java/org/kie/dmn/feel/runtime/functions/extended/KieExtendedDMNFunctions.java.

Thank you for using our products!

title: BPMN:Property
body:
how do I add a BPMN:Property through the editor?
If I use the properties advanced option its adding a meta tag

title: NA
body:
Hello @ArvindGundimajalu 

You mean adding a new field in some of the BPMN domain model objects? If so, lemme explain.

The main goal for _Metadata Attributes_, in the _Advanced Data_ section, is for adding any key-value pair which you can futther use on the runtime execution, but it's not itself being exposed (neither serialized in the BPMN file) as a concrete "new" field for the target object (task, whatever). Anyway, this field is useful because you can store metadata there, also it is being ported in the BPMN file , and use it on your runtime enviornment.

On he other hand, each model object, for instance a task, has a set of fields, each one showing as a separate field in the forms (look a tthe right panel _Properties_). Those fields usually are following the BPMN spec as well. These fields are being modeled as Java beans, in the core of the BPMN editor, see [1] and check all class fields annotated with the `@Property` annotation. 
So if you want to add fields at this level, you'll have to add new fields in the java class, and also I understand update the actual marshallers code for its proper serialization. It means you have to deal with the given repo [1] and use Java/GWT in order to do this. If at some point you're interested on, there are actually README's about how to build the repository and so you can play with it.  

Hope it helps!
Thanks

[1] https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/blob/main/packages/stunner-editors/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-sets/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn-api/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/bpmn/definition/Lane.java#L81

title: cannot delete a process variable if being used by another activity: Needs Error messaging
body:
using vscode.  If you try and modify or delete a process variable and that variable is being used in another activity (such as in Input/Output mappings), the delete button does not do anything and if you try and modify the name of the variable, it just returns to its original value. There needs to be some error messaging indicating why you cannot modify/delete the variable and where to find the associated configurations. Otherwise the user has to click around into each activity and into each input/out to find the various configurations.

Would be even better if there was a Variable usage inspector that showed the tree of usage for process variables. This would be a huge time saver!

title: Process Linter
body:
Hey
I am looking at replicating similar features as: https://github.com/StephenOTT/Workflow-Linter and https://github.com/camunda/camunda-modeler-linter-plugin but for Kogito.

Has there been work on this capability within Kogito?

In the above links, I have combined two types of linting: UI Linter which parses in JS and displays in the UI, and then  a server linter (which the UI can also use): where the server linter parses into the server presentation and runs a series of rules: This is great for modeler dev, but also deployment control to ensure processes/apps meet requirements and reduce bugs.

Initial review for server side lint led me to the https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-runtimes/blob/main/jbpm/jbpm-bpmn2/src/main/java/org/kie/kogito/process/bpmn2/BpmnProcessCompiler.java class which is used for compiling the .bpmn file into a Process Definition  / "BpmnProcess" ?

or ProcessCodegen.class?

Would love some general thoughts!

Thanks

title: Manual Task Support / No Task Type support
body:
When building processes, a common process is to mock out the entire process and leave certain steps as "manual task" steps which are skipped over by the engine, until that task is ready for implementation.

This allows the business to understand the process they want to build, and the developer to build/code in parallel.

It seems that there is no Manual Task supported in the modeler, and you cannot leave the task as a non task, as Kogito will return:

a Validation error of: "...Task has no task type."

Other than add everything as a user task, or a script task, etc, is there a viable alternative? 

Was manual task omitted by design?

Thanks!

title: CodeGen for processes uses unexpected unique id for task names: causes missing endpoints
body: Consider endpoints such as: ... and config that looks like this: **(Answer: There are only two task endpoints generated, but there are three unique task definitions)** The Name/TaskNames are not unique and not enforced to be unique during deployment. In the XML we have the ~true unique name: ```xml ... ... ``` ignoring the ~weird drools extensions that get auto added for a moment: ```xml ... ``` The `id` for a bpmn element is usually the unique identifier. The ID is not super friendly at the moment, and understandably someone chose something in the BPMN that would be cleaner. Would this suggest that Kogito wants to enforce unique Drools meta values ? IMO would be MUCh cleaner for XML readability if the extension was not used and the `id` property was used here. makes it much easier to read node execution history events as well. Either way, the at the moment the problem is endpoints do not get generated as expected. If we are saying that this is expected because the task instance ID would be unique, then why are we generated named endpoints (where the task endpoint has the Task Name in the url)? the answer seems to be so so you could have Schema support for each task, and if that is the case then we seem to be back to the issue described above.

@romartin  We are kind of assuming that TaskName is unique within a given process (if it is not, rumtime process will generate the same rest endpoint twice. This is going to be addressed with a different PR, at server side we are going to fail if the same taskName is find more than once). Also it will be good to indicate somehow that name property (in the top right) is for visual representation only, to make it clear the difference between it and the TaskName/id

title: VS-code: Process Editor should detect changes to properties form without having to defocus field
body:
Currently for when working with the BPMN editor in vs code, if you make a change to a property in the property editor/panel, in order for vs code to detect a change has occurred and allow saving, you have to defocus/click away from the field you have edited.

This behaviour makes it very difficult to use the Hot Reload and make rapid changes.  

Consider an example of writing a script.  You run and get an error, you make a change to the script and select CTRL+S / CMD+S and reload swagger/browser.  The change was not taken because the user did not click away from the property and so no save occurred.

title: In VS Code Workspace Include Models functionality does not work in DMN Editor & Custom Tasks are empty in BPMN Editor
body:
When developing decisions using VS Code Workspaces DMN Editor cannot include other DMN Models.
Also BPMN Editor Custom Tasks list is empty.

Steps to reproduce;

1. Open a KIE Project in VS Code
2. Add a second project in the same VS Code Workspace
3. Try to "Import Models" in DMN Editor
4. Try to add a Custom Task in BPM Editor

The steps 3, 4 fail as DMN Models list and Custom BPMN Tasks list is empty.

![bpmn_custom_tasks](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17730602/155694909-40b5f9d6-0feb-402f-9c6f-349735aee802.png)
![dmn_included_models](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17730602/155694911-84a52e32-c362-4d78-a45d-df80c649d701.png)

title: NA
NA
body:
Hello @yesamer and Thanks for your reply!

The problem is that both files are in the same directory but Editor behaves differently when a VS Code workspace is opened.

Although, include models functionality works fine in a single VS Code project, the above issue appears when a VS Code workspace (multiple projects) is open.

title: NA
body:
Hi @bouzasvas, ok thank you for giving me more details.
Yes, we still don't fully support the multi workspace scope VSCode offers. Thus, my recommendation is to use our extensions in a mono-workspace mode only, in order to don't slip into issues like the one you reported.

title: NA
body:
Hello again @yesamer and thanks for responding back.

Ok we will use mono-workspace mode for now. Do you know if included models will ever be supported in multi-workspace projects?

title: NA
body: @bouzasvas At this moment we don't have plans to implement multi-workspace support. Stay tuned with us, our https://kie.zulipchat.com/ zulip chat and https://blog.kie.org/ kie blog to stay updated :)

title: Unable to install kie-editors-standalone@0.17.0
body:
According to the [v0.17.0 README](https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/tree/0.17.0/packages/kie-editors-standalone#installation), I should be able to install it by running `npm install @kie-tools/kie-editors-standalone`

But I got an error
```
npm ERR! code E404
npm ERR! 404 Not Found - GET https://registry.npmjs.org/@kie-tools%2fkie-editors-standalone - Not found
npm ERR! 404 
npm ERR! 404  '@kie-tools/kie-editors-standalone@*' is not in this registry.
npm ERR! 404 You should bug the author to publish it (or use the name yourself!)
```

The 0.17.0 js files are not available at https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-online/tree/gh-pages/standalone as well (0.16.0 and older versions are available there).

Versions 0.16.0 and before are available at https://www.npmjs.com/package/@kogito-tooling/kie-editors-standalone
I guess there is a publishing issue since the repository rename that happened on 2002-01-26 (https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/commit/cf0d1f8b8bdd173f817596a6f1fefaaa4b1e9872).

title: NA
body:
Hi @tbouffard, you're right, there was an instability during our 0.17.0 release. This was caused by Quay.io not being able to accept pushes to new image versions, so we opted to not include any packages other than the VS Code Extensions in the release, which featured the new Serverless Workflow Editor extension.

We apologize for this package not being available at the moment and that the instructions on the README are currently out of date. We expect that the next release will include all the artifacts as we've been doing before 0.17.0.

title: NA
body:
OK thanks for the explanations and the quick feedback.

Can we keep this issue opened until the new release is available?
I monitor releases in this repository so I will give a try to the next version when it is released.

title: More informative SCESIM Error messages
body:
Testing is driven by understanding errors and correcting them.
It is very difficult to use SCESIM for meaningful testing, due to the lack of meaningful error messages.
I can't diagnose anything from the simple "NoSuchElementException".  Which element?
The DMN file works fine from the command line using 'jbang'. 
Takes 1 string, returns 1 string translated.

```
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Test set: com.example.KogitoScenarioJunitActivatorTest
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.004 s <<< FAILURE! - in com.example.KogitoScenarioJunitActivatorTest
initializationError  Time elapsed: 0.002 s  <<< ERROR!
org.drools.scenariosimulation.backend.runner.ScenarioException: Issue on parsing file: /src/DMN_Test/target/test-classes/abrtest.scesim
Caused by: java.util.NoSuchElementException
```

title: Element DMN InputData
body: Please tell me where the logic for creating elements (more precisely, the InputData element) is located. I need to move the button for creating this element outside the editor itself, but so that when this button is pressed, this element is created inside the editor.

title: NA
body:
I found how creating a button works through java code, which is rendered in the browser through the errai framework.

Ways:
1). Buttons responsible for deleting and creating links - kie-tools-main/packages/stunner-editors/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-client/kie-wb-common-stunner-lienzo/src /main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/client/lienzo/components/mediators
2). Input Data element - kie-tools-main/packages/stunner-editors/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-client/kie-wb-common-stunner-widgets/src/main/java/ org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/client/widgets/inlineeditor

errai framework documentation - https://docs.jboss.org/errai/3.2.0-SNAPSHOT/errai/reference/html/sid-51806600.html

I understood this. But you don't understand it in test.html. Please tell me.

title: Feature Request - Dark mode
body:
I find it hard on the eyes to look at a large screen with a white background especially after sunset.

I've tried to use the [Dark Reader](https://darkreader.org/)  google chrome extension, but the diagram elements still render in black on a near black background making the page unusable.

If there's any chance a dark mode could be made or at least some tweak to make the site more friendly to use with Dark Reader, it would certainly be appreciated.  Thanks.

title: Feature Request: Importing data types from sample datasets
body:
## Feature idea: 
take a sample datasets of JSON and attempt to derive the data types from the observed values across it's numerous records automatically. 

## Background:
I'm currently struggling with creating data types that match the data I load from the `Run`... 

Rather than records being loaded, I get a number of empty rows that match the row count of the input file. 

I don't know what I'm doing wrong, since there's no feedback in the UI or my kie-Sandbox podman container console.

Was thinking this could be much easier if the data types screen could have an "Auto detect data type from sample JSON dataset file", where I could feed it 10 to a 100 JSON records and let an algorithm observe what data types match for the values observed in each field.

I'm sure something like this is much easier said than done, but I think it would make getting started a *lot* easier.

title: NA
body:
As a follow-up to the blank rows I observed, I think I now know why I see this:

- I created a Data type structure called `SimpleTX` (id,vendor,amount,description,category_id all of type `any`), created a `DMN Input Data` put it's data type properties to `SimpleTX`
- Next I uploaded JSON data, the data matches the structure of `SimpleTX`, however there's no mention of the Input name or data type in json records
```json
[{"id":1,"amount":1485.19,"category_id":2,"vendor":"Skaboo","description":"Compactor"},
{"id":2,"amount":493.37,"category_id":97,"vendor":"Voolith","description":"Backhoe"},
{"id":3,"amount":2855.0,"category_id":80,"vendor":"Gabspot","description":"Scraper"}]
```
- This creates blank rows
- When I do a `Download inputs` my JSON looks like:
```json
[
  {
    "InputData-1": {},
    "id": 1,
    "amount": 1485.19,
    "category_id": 2,
    "vendor": "Skaboo",
    "description": "Compactor"
  },
  {
    "InputData-1": {},
    "id": 2,
    "amount": 493.37,
    "category_id": 97,
    "vendor": "Voolith",
    "description": "Backhoe"
  },
  {
    "InputData-1": {},
    "id": 3,
    "amount": 2855,
    "category_id": 80,
    "vendor": "Gabspot",
    "description": "Scraper"
  }
]
```
So the data is there, but not in the format DMN was expecting (when I uploaded it originally), so this is my bad as a user...

title: NA
body: @deftdawg thank you so much for the suggestion. We will triage this and follow up this feature request here: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-7543

title: Crash when loaded input data is incorrectly formatted.
body:
In my efforts to import data, I accidentally triggered a UI crash.

This is my workspace:
[CrashTest.dmn.txt](https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/files/9056392/CrashTest.dmn.txt)
 
Here is the data I sent to it:
cat 3-rows.json | jq -s '{"InputData-1":.[]}'
```json
{
  "InputData-1": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "amount": 1485.19,
      "category_id": 2,
      "vendor": "Skaboo",
      "description": "Compactor"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "amount": 493.37,
      "category_id": 97,
      "vendor": "Voolith",
      "description": "Backhoe"
    },
    {
      "id": 3,
      "amount": 2855,
      "category_id": 80,
      "vendor": "Gabspot",
      "description": "Scraper"
    }
  ]
}
```

I know the data is not the expected format; it should be a list of `InputData-1` objects rather than an `InputData-1` list, however this should result in an error message rather than an unrecoverable crash.    The workspace is now lost with no way to recover it unless the user had previously downloaded their workspace as a DMN file.
![dmn-crash](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4991612/177595793-60b5af40-f988-4a74-a233-801aab5d85e1.png)

title: NA
body:
This is the command I should've used for the data to have the correct format:
```sh
cat 3-rows.json | jq 'map( {"InputData-1":.} )'
```

title: Date Time parsing of input formatted as yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss silently fails
body:
I have some JSON data that I'd like to import, if I set the Data Type for the field to `Any` it loads as a string, if I set the format to `Date and Time` input loading fails completely, the Form panel indicates I should check for `validations` however the validations count is `0`

![date-time-parse-issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4991612/177617747-4a13d707-5101-4c3c-9e23-65a6f2417e6c.png)

Here is the data that breaks things:
```json
      "transaction_date": "2021-01-01T00:00:00",
```

I've also tried setting the field type to `date` and the data loads but it is not parsed as a date properly showing full string (and the date picker shows today's date when opened).

Here's the console message from the browser with info on the error:

title: [VS Code] Kogito Serverless Workflow Editor - prompts for automatic opening on every json file
body:
Kogito Serverless Workflow Editor VS Code extension - prompts for automatic opening on every plain `.json` file in every single project - if confirmed creates project settings.json file.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7010458/180091700-9b358712-8568-40cd-8d2a-442a27a6f76e.png)

I would expect that the prompt should only appear on following files: (`*.sw.json`, `*.sw.yaml`, `*.sw.yml`) - otherwise it is pretty annoying. Also why project settings instead of top vs code settings?

Once the prompt appears it doesn't go away until you decide on one of the 2 options provided (there is not even ignore option) or to be exact it reappears on switching between any tabs.

title: NA
body: @thiagoelg can you please take a look at this?

Doesn't look like our build has ever run on an arm64 Linux before. I occasionally develop on my M1 MacBook Air, which would be arm64 macOS, but I've never had such failures. Glad to know you were able to setup an amd64 VM.

Regarding the Java issue,  I have no idea what could be happening. We use OpenJDK 11 on our CI and I've never seen this error before. If you have access to another amd64 environment and could try and reproduce, maybe this would be a good start to finding the root cause.

body:
This was fixed with this PR: https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/pull/1115, but it was not included in the 0.21.0 release.

It should be included in the next release (0.22.0), but for now, you could temporarily set the SVG path manually in the extension settings or build a new VSIX from the main branch.

title: DMN Editor Import Java Datatype disabled
body:
I try to use a domain model from a maven dependency within a kjar generated by the archetype.
When I open the kjar project with DMN Editor plugin, navigate to the _Data Types_ Tab, the _Import Java classes_ Button is disabled.
I've created a project to reproduce the problem under [MBoegers/kjar-with-domain-from-dependency](https://github.com/MBoegers/kjar-with-domain-from-dependency)

org.kie.version: 7.73.0.Final

plugin version: v0.21.0

Error from Developer Tools
```
dmn-loader.js:2 Error: Internal error.
    at e.callback (DmnEditorEnvelopeApp.js:2:517269)
    at e.receive (DmnEditorEnvelopeApp.js:2:519025)
    at Object.receive (DmnEditorEnvelopeApp.js:2:514342)
    at e.receive (DmnEditorEnvelopeApp.js:2:521554)
    at eventListener.eventListener (DmnEditorEnvelopeApp.js:2:520714)
(anonymous) @ dmn-loader.js:2
Promise.catch (async)
(anonymous) @ dmn-loader.js:2
Pl @ dmn-loader.js:2
t.unstable_runWithPriority @ dmn-loader.js:2
Yo @ dmn-loader.js:2
Bl @ dmn-loader.js:2
(anonymous) @ dmn-loader.js:2
R @ dmn-loader.js:2
w.port1.onmessage @ dmn-loader.js:2
```

title: NA
body:
Hi @MBoegers!
To enable the `Import Java Classes` button, you can refer to [my blog post in kie blog](https://blog.kie.org/2022/05/dmn-types-from-java-classes.html)
Please keep in mind this feature is designed to work with `kogito` (https://kogito.kie.org/), which is not your case (as you are using the `7.x` kie version. 
Despite the feature wasn't tested with the `7.x` stream, it should work. Pay attention when using the `@KieActivator` annotation. That could require importing `kie-api` dependency in your project.
Let me know if face any issues.

title: NA
body:
Hi @yesamer the new popup provides better information, thanks for that improvement.

I can not make it work with 7.x nor with 8.x.. 
My process:
1. create project with ´mvn archetype:generate -DarchetypeGroupId=org.kie -DarchetypeArtifactId=kie-kjar-archetype -DarchetypeVersion=8.26.0.Beta´ (for 7.x I used archetype version 7.73.0.Final)
2. add Person class with public getter/setter to ´src/main/java/io/..´
3. add class with Annotation ´org.kie.api.project.KieActivator.KieActivator´ in same package as Person
4. run mvn package
5. add Person.dmn to _src/main/resources_

The Button stays disables, but with the new popup message. I've updated my reproducer, maybe you can see where I've missed something.

VSCode version: 1.70.2, Language Support for Java by Red Hat v1.9.0, Red Hat Business Automation Bundle v0.22..0

**Edit:** with the dmn-quarkus-example it is possible, so it seems to be an issue with my setup..

title: NA
body: @MBoegers I'm able to reproduce the issue, it's a bug on our side. I'll provide a fix in the same PR.

title: NA
body: @MBoegers PR updated. That fix would be part of the next `0.23.0` release.

title: NA
body: @MBoegers 0.23.0 version has been released. Can you please check and eventually close this issue? Thx!

title: NA
body: @MBoegers feel free to reopen if the issue is not fixed!

title: NA
body:
Hi, sorry for not responding here, whole was family was _attacked_ by flue. 
I can verify that the button is enabled at every time and the dialog provides expected Java classes, at least for KIE 8 ;)
Thanks for the fix!

title: Kie Extended Services 0.22.0 reporting wrong version number (0.21.0) causing error in KIE Sandbox
body:
Currently running the KIE Sandbox  https://sandbox.kie.org/#/ on Windows 11 using Firefox / Chrome.

Updated to latest version (kie_sandbox_extended_services_windows_0.22.0.exe) using the link provided under the Run tab in the sandbox. 

Kie Sandbox still gives message "Warning alert:KIE Sandbox Extended Services is outdated!" even after update.

On investigation (opening http://localhost:21345/ping) the JSON returned still contains the old version number.

{"App":{"Version":"0.21.0"},"Proxy":{"IP":"0.0.0.0","Port":21345,"InsecureSkipVerify":false},"Modeler":{"Link":"https://kiegroup.github.io/kogito-online/#/"}}

title: NA
body:
Hi @paulbrowne-irl, thanks for reaching out!

I did some tests on a Windows OS but I wasn't able to reproduce this issue.

Could you please confirm that this issue is reproducible even with the `kie_sandbox_extended_services_windows_0.22.0.exe` process being shown in the Task Manager?

title: NA
body:
Did a full system restart (again) including a hard refresh of the browser cache (just in case). 

This time the version number has successfully updated to 0.22 - I did *not* re-download the .exe file so the issue was definitely local to my PC (and am slightly embarrassed to have taken your time on this).

Thank you for your time and your response.

title: NA
body: No problems, @paulbrowne-irl! I'm glad everything worked out well. :)

title: NA
body: Hi @krakzk, please try to use `pnpm -r -F kie-editors-standalone... build:dev` as the command for the third step. Adding the 3 dots will compile the required dependencies for `kie-editors-standalone`, which are the ones not found during your tentative (eg. `TS2307: Cannot find module '@kie-tools-core/notifications/` )

title: NA
body: Yes, was a silly mistake. Closing the issue.

title: BPMN and DMN files are being emptied when opening the modellen
body: In some case when opening a DMN or BPMN file after (re)starting visual studio the contents of the model are being deleted resulting in an empty file and loss of the model. I haven't found a cause or trigger for this behaviour (yet).

title: NA
body:

Which OS are you using? Does this happen during the normal operation of the visual editor? 

Why the VS Code restart happen?

body: I'm using windows 11 with visual studio code 1.70.2 but I had the same problem before on windows. The problem seems to be project/folder related and happens over time. When I create a new project/folder the problem will go away for some time until it starts happening again. The VS Code (re)start is manual after not using VS code for a while or after a shutdown.

2. Does the content of the file becomes completely empty or is there some XML left there?

1. No
2. Completely empty, The file is being emptied when it is openend in visual studio.

I'm trying to make a reproduction video but it hasn't happened for I while now.

Reproduction steps are:
1. Close Visual Studio
2. Start Visual Studio
3. Open an existing BPM or DMN file from an open project. -> In some cases the contents of the file are being deleted on opening (filesize becomes 0 bytes) and an empty model is being shown.
4. If I restore the file from a back-up it will not be emptied again in the same session. However a close and restart of VS code my trigger the same behavoire again for that specific file.

It looks like it only happens with some of my DMN/BPMN files but I haven't found a pattern yet and it might be because I'm working more on those at that point in time.

title: NA
body:
Hi @NeilBreems, the second comment you posted contains log info relevant to your issue.
But IMHO, that is the consequence of the issue, not the root cause.
It seems to me that the editor is trying to open an empty (0-byte) asset, so the deletion of the file content already occurred.
What you should discover is the exact moment when the file is emptied, and in particular:
- When do you close VSCode?
- When do you open VSCode?
You can use another external text editor (or just keep an eye on file properties) to understand when the deletion actually occurs.
In addition, I would check if other processes or tools are accessing the file.
Thank you

title: NA
body:
.@NeilBreems That's useful, thank you. 
Speaking of the DMN file, I noticed the following steps:
- You opened the DMN file.
- You modified it.
- You closed VSCode without saving the file
Now, VSCode has a mechanism that saves a copy of the unsaved file in a hidden directory in your user space, usually located here `C:\Users\<USERNAME>\AppData\Roaming\Code\Backups`. Said so, I expect to see a copy of your unsaved DMN assets there. 
According to the message you shared:
 `ERR Error: Cannot back up in this state: Cannot read properties of
undefined (reading 'getContent')
    at co.backup (mainThreadCustomEditors.ts:711:9)
    at process.processTicksAndRejections
(node:internal/process/task_queues:96:5)
    at async workingCopyBackupTracker.ts:191:21`
Something wrong is happening during this phase, i.e during this backup phase. 
Now, as a next step, I would try to understand if the error is during the backup write or during the backup read.

title: NA
body:
@NeilBreems I know how to find the backup of the unsaved file. This procedure works for mac-os, in Windows could be a bit different.
1. Go into `/Users/<username>/Library/Application Support/Code/Backups` directory (in your `C:\Users\<USERNAME>\AppData\Roaming\Code\Backups`
2. Here, you should see a directory with a long alphanumeric name. Enter into that directory.
3. Here, you should see another directory `vscode-custom-editor`. Enter into that directory.
4. Here you should see a file. Open it with a text editor. This file contains metadata related to your vscode session, I guess. You should notice here the path of the original DMN file you opened.
5. In the file, please search for this key: `backupId`. That variable contains the actual location of the unsaved DMN file. Eg, in my case the path is: 
`"backupId":"/Users/<username>/Library/Application Support/Code/User/workspaceStorage/5bfd610b760e5de8bbd37ecfaa736e6f/kie-group.vscode-extension-pack-kogito-kie-editors/-14811927521"`
`-14811927521` is the unsaved DMN file.
6. At this point, I would ask you if that file exists, if it correctly contains the unsaved changes you applied to the file and the file read and write permissions.

Hope this can help to find the issue!

title: Failure trying to run stunner-editor.
body:
I have tried the following steps to start the stunner in my localhost. 
Clone the repo, ran the bootstrap and build commands for stunner-editors which were success.
Then I followed

 change to the kie-tools/packages/stunner-editors/kie-wb-common-stunner root folder
**_run mvn clean install -DskipTests -Dgwt.compiler.skip=true_**
Build the webapp:
Dev: **_mvn -T 8C clean install -DskipTests=true -Ddev_** 

Those too were success.
Then i ran the **_mvn gwt:run_**  command, but getting the below error:

**[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.codehaus.mojo:gwt-maven-plugin:2.9.0:run (default-cli) on project kie-wb-common-stunner: The parameters 'runTarget' for goal org.codehaus.mojo:gwt-maven-plugin:2.9.0:run are missing or invalid**

title: NA
body:
Hello @krakzk 

This error is because the command `mvn gwt:run` is being executed in the `kie-wb-common-stunner` root, but the root module doesn't contain itself a gwt app module. 

Just run the `mvn gwt:run` command in the [kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn-kogito-runtime](https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/tree/main/packages/stunner-editors/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-sets/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn-kogito-runtime) root instead.

Sorry for the inconveniences, as I see the the [README](https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/tree/main/packages/stunner-editors/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-sets/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn-kogito-runtime#running-in-sdm) is not specifying to change the root. I am just going to create a PR to fix the readme :)

Thanks for your feedback!

title: NA
body: PR created: https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/pull/1234

title: NA
body: Thanks  @krakzk for the feedback. Closing the issue for now. Please feel free to reopen or create a new ticket if any further issues or Qs. Thanks!

title: Add Custom Actors in Dropdown search of BPMN User Task
body:
This is a question, not basically an issue.

I am new to kie-tools environment. Was trying around changing various properties for the BPMN editor.

Trying to find a way to inject my set of actors and groups to the User Tasks.
I am running the kogito-bpmn-runitime app test.html.

Any help would be appreciated.

title: NA
body:
Hello @krakzk,

thank you for your question!

Some high level overview of the way forms works in Stunner:
there exist:
- [model classes](https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/blob/e7cee444fe6cc55d47606e387ba49776da9c6f10/packages/stunner-editors/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-sets/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn-api/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/bpmn/definition/property/task/UserTaskExecutionSet.java): like Actors or Groupid -> those are storing the state for a field
- provider classes: populate the model
- renderer classes: renders the model in some way in the html (eg: by using custom renderer)

For Actors and Groups there is a bit difference because they share the same Form element.
Forms code is located [here](https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/tree/4251fbbbc8f8d546a569be32462be709cc925eef/packages/stunner-editors/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-sets/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn-client/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/bpmn/client/forms/fields/assigneeEditor).
You can see `widget` package which actually a renderer and `*SearchService` which is doing what you actually need there.

Take a look at `search` method which is called by the Form element on load and populating predefined values. Just add values to [this collection](https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/blob/4251fbbbc8f8d546a569be32462be709cc925eef/packages/stunner-editors/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-sets/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn-client/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/bpmn/client/forms/fields/assigneeEditor/AssigneeLocalSearchService.java#L55) and it should be it.

Let me know if you have any further questions, thank you!

title: NA
body:
Hello @hasys ,

I have Users and Groups available in keycloak, is there a way where it can be integrated with the Live Search?

title: NA
body:
Hey @moaazabir 

I understand you're using the process editor in the Business Central. Please let me know otherwise.

In that case, as far as I remember, the `actors` and `groups` fields are actually consuming the users / groups from the `Users Management` subsystem. By default, if nothing configured, the subsystem reads the own wildfly realm (properties files). But you can configure it properly, by making the users management to consume your keycloak realm, instead of the properties files, so both fields will automatically be populated with the information from the keycloak server, no need for code customizations, it's just about configuring your workbench. 

For more information about how to configure the workbench users management see [1]

Also, you can find more detailed technical information about the security management and, in concrete, the keycloak security provider at  [2]

[1] https://docs.jbpm.org/7.73.0.Final/jbpm-docs/html_single/#_keycloak_and_the_business_centrals_security_administration_area

[2] https://github.com/kiegroup/appformer/tree/main/uberfire-extensions/uberfire-security/uberfire-security-management

CC @hasys

title: NA
body:
@moaazabir  Thank you for raising the question.
@romartin  What if I am running the stunner editor as a standalone? And i get the Users/Actors and Groups as a JSON response invoking an API?

title: NA
body:
The solution final is present in the below link
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/73698809/add-custom-actors-and-groups-in-kogito-user-task/73715252?noredirect=1#comment130192756_73715252

title: Reload setup for BPMN runtime editor in Intellij
body:
I have Intellij 2021.3.2 Community edition installed in my system. But I am unable to follow up the setting to get the reload and on the go update for the BPMN editor code (even only the CSS would do).
Is there any steps I could follow ?
The doc found in the repo seems to be for Intellij 15 and not able to set that up either.

Using different editor like VSCode is also accepatble, if any setup steps to be followed can be provided

title: NA
body:
Hello @krakzk 

Please take a look at the updated [README](https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/blob/main/packages/stunner-editors/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-sets/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn-kogito-runtime/README.md) for running the bpmn editor showcase app. The configurations for making the app to run are quite simple, and they do apply also for latest IntelliJ IDEA versions (as we're internally also using it).

In general I am using these simple steps:
1.- Create new maven project by importing from [kie-wb-common-stunner](https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/tree/main/packages/stunner-editors/kie-wb-common-stunner) root (File -> Import project from existing sources -> choose maven project)
2.- Create the GWT run/app configuration as described in the README
3.- Right click on root folder -> maven -> reload project
4.- Menu Build -> Rebuild project
5.- Click on Run icon to start the GWT App configured in step 2

This way, all stunner and BPMN modules are part of the project, so you can change any file and hot reload plugin will detect properly.

In case you still are running into issues, can you please share more feedback in order to figure out what the issue is:
1. Share screenshots or info about with your GWT run/debug config
2. Share screenshots of info about the project structure

Let's keep in touch!
Thanks!

title: NA
body:
Not able to get the GWT configuration setting. 
IntelliJ IDEA 2021.3.2 (Community Edition) -  This my IDE spec.
Tried installing the GWT support plugin available in the Marketplace, still no success.

Java 17.0.2 is being used

title: NA
body:
Any update on this? 
To setup the env in the latest Intellij Community version

title: NA
body:
Hi @krakzk the is currently not a plugin supporting GWT on the Community Edition, the recommended way of running it is through CLI. Here are some steps

1) Go to :/kie-tools/packages/stunner-editors/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-sets/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn-kogito-runtime
2) execute mvn clean gwt:run
* The hot reload feature should work fine 
* There have been some issues on MAC OS where GWT.log does not work well
You can of course use IntelliJ CE or any other editor to do the changes and the hot reload will work when you reload the page.
Let me know if this worked for you

title: DMN editor - decision tables are slow
body:
Hi,
we have one larger DMN which is using decision tables. It is slower and slower and after some investigation we think that it is caused by decision tables. Every field no matter if it is filled or not, is represented in XML as '-'. Then it grows and grows and if you have more inputs and rows, it grows quadratically.
I've tried to check and find where exactly is this solved but I'm not FE developer so it is hard for me.
Can you give me any hint if this is feature or bug/bad design? 
Thanks !
[testCase2.zip](https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/files/9787112/testCase2.zip)

title: NA
body: Hi @msusicky, thank you for reporting that. Yeah, I noticed the slowness opening that Decision Table. We have big plans to totally revisit that component in the near future: a refactoring of that component is currently in progress. The editor gives you the opportunity to test the new version of the component, in this way: Above the Decision Table, you should see this section: Press on the "Click here" link, and you will see the BETA version of the new component currently under development. You may notice that the slowness doesn't affect the new component. In the next months, we plan to remove the current stable (and old) version with the new one. You can learn more about the new component in this blog post https://blog.kie.org/2021/09/new-dmn-boxed-expression-editor-what-is-new.html

title: NA
body:
Thanks for your answer -> in fact we are having more than 15k fields in multiple decision tables in one huge decision process and it takes minutes to load this DMN. (Business central/Drools) We will definitely try to split the DMN but do you have any estimate when the new coponent will be available and the old one discarded? 
Thanks!

title: NA
body: @msusicky At this moment I don't have a precise ETA to share. Undoubtedly, that represents one of the most important tasks for the short-medium terms plan of the editor development, we will definitely invest time to complete the component transition.  Stay tuned with us for more precise updates.

title: NA
body: Is it possible to somehow compile / turn off completely the old version of editor and use only the new one? When we import the DMN it is taking so long to load it and we'd like to test the new editor only. (it will hopefully approve that this is the bottleneck we have there)

title: NA
NA
body:
Hi, thanks. I'm playing with the new editor but it is still slow - I have troubles with even loading DMN to the editor. I've checked the memory consumption and it is accumulating during the load to a hundreds of MB and when it is loaded then it drops to ~ 100MB.
We've tested it on two computers and on newer CPU it is significantly faster (3x). Intel 8850H vs 11850H. I will continue with the investigation on my own but if you can point me to two locations - where is DMN XML parsed and where to turn off the old editor - it will save me some time. (I'm not a FE developer)

title: NA
body:
Hi @msusicky, thank you for your analysis and your contribution. 
Of course, the marshaller module requires performance optimization. We decided to increase the priority of this task, so the good news is we'll focus on this in the next few days. 
About your questions:
- To find the location to enable the new Boxed Expression, you can refer to my branch and compare it with the main branch;
- The marshaller lives in https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/tree/main/packages/stunner-editors/kie-wb-common-dmn/kie-wb-common-dmn-webapp-kogito-marshaller module

title: NA
body:
Hi @yesamer , I have an interesting news for you. I've worked on this issue further and I have two findings:

- If there is a huge hardcoded string as a feel expression, then the hashCode javascript function is extremely slow. We have ~ 20kB JSON string hardcoded for testing purposes and after a removal it is faster.
- Used GWT is old, there is a possibility to upgrade to version 2.10. When I did it (but I had to comment out stunner-editors\kie-wb-common-dmn\kie-wb-common-dmn-webapp-kogito-testing artifact because of classpath conflicts) I have more than 100% speedup

"Benchmark, 2 runs, time in min:ss to load the DMN to desktop, DMN size 1.2 MB, Intel 8850H, 16GB RAM, latest Chrome"
1:17 - 2.10 GWT
1:24 - 2.10 GWT
3:20 - 2.9 GWT 0.25
3:10 - 2.9 GWT 0.25
-> the same speedup is on the faster CPU/another PC

Should I create a new ticket for GWT upgrade proposal? I think it is definitely a low hanging fruit. I can share what I did.

title: NA
body: @msusicky thank you for your very interesting findings!! I already opened 2 tickets based on your analysis. Can you please share a reproducer for the first case you mentioned?

title: NA
body: I cannot send the original one (NDA) but will try to prepare some anonymized example in the following days.

title: NA
body:
Identified two more interesting things - 1. M1 Apple is approximately two times faster than 11850H. 2. Probably there is a trouble with function computeGraphHashCode, we have larger graph and it looks that we have 30+ layers - see the stacktrace. I've tried to find this functionality in code but was not successful yet. We use heavilly DRD diagrams.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1258380/200426011-29abe195-5b06-45e2-bd21-6e1e593004b1.png)

title: NA
body:
Hi @msusicky, I experimented a bit with the new GWT 2.10 version. During my experiments, I didn't notice such a huge performance improvement. The tested scenario is: DMN Editor opening and DMN file loading.
Depending on the DMN assets size, (from 100 k to 1 MB ~) I observed no more than 1 / 2 seconds of improvement during the editor loading phase.
Better than nothing, so the PR is coming. 
In any case, I'm curious to know how you reached that huge performance improvement, so I would like to take a look at your changes if you have a branch to share.

title: NA
body:
I have two examples here - version 3 takes on my PC around 8 sec and no difference in GWT 2.9 vs.2.10. Version 4 is 8 vs. 12 seconds !
[sample-slow-dmn.zip](https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-tools/files/10057836/sample-slow-dmn.zip) In version 4 I've added some empty decision tables only, so only 40kB of code. I think it has something to do with the graph complexity. And sorry - I think that the description of this issue is confusing, I think I'm mixing more different causes.

I will prepare my branch tommorow.

title: NA
body:

Loads the BPMN Editor UI even when joining a live share session and not hosting it.

title: Editor: Feature Missing - Unable to see already linked DRDs for a component
body:
**Problem:**

Imagine that I have a DRG with several decision and I decided to "hide" the decision complexity using DRDs.
So, I would design the DRG first, and then I would one by one add DRD for each DRG decision.

There is a quick and simple way, how to add a decision from DRG to a DRD - using DRD Actions ("share" icon on the component), Create.

The problem is that on the DRG level you are not able to see to which DRD(s) is the DRG decision linked to. The only way how to "drill down" from DRG to the linked DRD is to go and search for the DRG decision name in Decision Navigator / Decision Graphs. In case you have tens or hundreds of DRDs, this becomes extremely user unfriendly (in the VS Code plugin, you cannot even use Ctrl+F to search in DRD list and you have to scroll through all Decision Graphs)

The situation is the same, if you use DRD decision in another DRD diagram.


**Suggestion:**

Add a list of all linked DRDs on the component in the editor.
If the user clicks on one of the DRDs in the list, it gets the user to the selected DRD.

Such list could be added as a new icon for the component in the editor or as part of the DRD Actions list.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/106966707/205261001-e31f3f9b-3f72-4dcf-84f9-d4af9f293bb4.png)


Thank you in advance for looking into this issue.

Regards,
Lukas

title: SVG export creates invalid text-decoration attribute
body:
I'm using VSCode Extension BPMN Editor to create BPMN diagrams. However the SVG contains 'text' nodes with a 'text-decoration' attribute of value "normal" like this:

`<text fill="#000000" stroke="none" font-family="Open Sans" font-size="10pt" font-style="normal" font-weight="normal" text-decoration="normal" x="0" y="8.8" text-anchor="start" dominant-baseline="alphabetic">text</text>`

As far as I can tell, this is not a specified option. [https://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/text.html#TextDecorationProperties](https://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/text.html#TextDecorationProperties)

It's causing my SVG viewer to error out.
